title: Global News Roundup: Week of December 15–21, 2025
content:
Global News Roundup: Week of December 15–21, 2025

A week of fragile ceasefires, international resolutions, targeted strikes, and escalating tensions in the Middle East echoes biblical warnings of false peace, global opposition to Israel, and end-times conflicts. Below are 20 key stories, each illuminated by Scripture, showing alignment with God's prophetic plan.

1. Israel says no to UN resolution demanding it work with UNRWA

Source: JNS.org, December 15, 2025

Israel rejects UN demand to cooperate with UNRWA, citing agency workers' involvement in Oct. 7 atrocities.

Zechariah 12:3 portrays Jerusalem as a burdensome stone. Israel's defiance of UN resolutions on UNRWA reflects growing international pressure, fulfilling prophecies where nations burden themselves with Israel before divine judgment.

2. UN backs ICJ declaration that UNRWA isn't infiltrated by Hamas; Israel denounces vote

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

General Assembly endorses UNRWA's non-infiltration; US and Israel condemn as biased.

Psalm 83 describes conspiracies against Israel. UN's defense of UNRWA despite evidence signals allied plots, aligning with end-times coalitions provoking God's wrath and ultimate defeat of Israel's foes.

3. ISF will not fight Hamas, say US officials, who still seek to deploy force next month

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

International Stabilization Force plans proceed without direct combat role against Hamas.

Daniel 9:27 warns of a deceptive covenant. US-led force deployment amid unclear disarmament echoes false peace efforts, potentially preluding the Antichrist's broken treaty and tribulation chaos.

4. Gaza stabilization force proposal by U.S. gets pushback from Russia, China and Arabs

Source: PBS NewsHour, December 15, 2025

Major powers resist American initiative for post-war Gaza security.

Ezekiel 38:13 questions challenging allies. Pushback from Russia, China, and Arabs highlights fracturing global coalitions, prophetic of end-times divisions before Gog-Magog's assault on Israel.

5. US presses other countries to send troops to Gaza, but none have stepped forward yet

Source: MSN, December 15, 2025

International reluctance hampers stabilization plans.

1 Thessalonians 5:3 foretells destruction amid peace cries. Lack of troop commitments despite US pressure reveals fragile accords, echoing prophetic false security before sudden end-times turmoil.

6. US asked over 70 countries to support proposed Gaza stabilization force - report

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Broad outreach yields limited enthusiasm.

Zechariah 14:2 gathers nations against Jerusalem. Widespread solicitation for Gaza force involvement burdens the world with Israel, fulfilling prophecies leading to the Lord's plague on opposing armies.

7. Israeli non-profit mobilizes over 100,000 volunteers to save farms after Oct 7 Hamas attacks

Source: All Israel News, December 15, 2025

Massive volunteer effort sustains agriculture post-terror.

Amos 9:14-15 promises replanting and permanence. Volunteer mobilization to restore farms embodies God's regathering, prophetic of Israel's fruitful restoration despite attacks in the latter days.

8. Gaza storms kill 14 Palestinians, including 3 children

Source: CNN, December 15, 2025

Severe weather claims lives amid fragile ceasefire.

Luke 21:25 warns of roaring seas and distress. Deadly storms in Gaza compound suffering, aligning with end-times signs of natural upheavals as birth pains before redemption.

9. IDF says it killed terrorist who crossed Gaza ceasefire line

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Incident highlights ceasefire vulnerabilities.

Matthew 24:6 speaks of wars until the end. Ceasefire violations underscore ongoing threats, prophetic of conflicts persisting until Christ's return enforces true peace.

10. Israel Says It Killed Senior Hamas Commander, Despite Cease-Fire

Source: DNYUZ, December 15, 2025

Targeted strike eliminates key Oct. 7 planner.

Obadiah 1:18 foretells consuming enemies. Killing of Hamas leader Raad Saad fulfills purging threats, prophetic of Israel's defense against ancient foes before millennial security.

11. IDF: Top Hamas commander Raad Saad, a key planner of Oct. 7, killed in Gaza City strike

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Airstrike responds to IED attack on troops.

Psalm 91:8 promises seeing wicked's recompense. Precise elimination of Oct. 7 architect signals justice, aligning with end-times vindication of God's people against terror.

12. Israel said to hope killing of Raad Saad doesn't delay return of last hostage's body

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Concerns over ceasefire implications.

Isaiah 49:25 contends for captives. Hopes amid hostage negotiations reflect prophetic rescue promises, where God redeems His people from oppressors in the last days.

13. US briefly withheld some intel from Israel under Biden over concerns on Gaza conduct

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Past restrictions revealed post-administration.

Genesis 12:3 blesses those blessing Israel. Withheld intel under prior US policy highlights shifting alliances, prophetic of nations turning against Israel before divine blessing reversal.

14. Top ADL civil rights lay leader quits, accusing group of being 'useful idiot' for Trump

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Internal divisions over political focus emerge.

Matthew 10:36 notes enemies in one's household. ADL rift over antisemitism response mirrors end-times divisions among God's people, testing faithfulness amid rising hatred.

15. West Bank violence is soaring, fueled by a capitulation of Israeli institutions to settlers' interests

Source: The Conversation, December 15, 2025

Analysis blames institutional biases for escalation.

Joel 3:2 judges for scattering and dividing land. Rising West Bank violence amid settlements fulfills warnings against internal and external divisions of biblical territories.

16. Cabinet legalizes 19 West Bank outposts, including 2 vacated in 2005 disengagement

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Government affirms settlements despite international criticism.

Numbers 33:53 commands possessing the land. Legalization of outposts reclaims biblical areas, prophetic of Israel's expansion resisting global opposition before kingdom fulfillment.

17. IDF says troops killed Palestinian who threw bomb at them in West Bank

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Defensive action amid ongoing attacks.

Deuteronomy 32:43 avenges His servants' blood. IDF response to violence embodies biblical justice, foreshadowing God's ultimate vengeance on Israel's enemies in the day of the Lord.

18. Lebanese FM: Beirut has been warned of possible Israeli offensive against Hezbollah

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Warnings aim to prevent escalation.

Ezekiel 38 includes Lebanon-area allies against Israel. Warnings of strikes on Hezbollah signal northern threats, prophetic of end-times coalitions crumbling under divine fire.

19. In first, IDF calls off attack on Hezbollah after Lebanese army springs into action

Source: The Jerusalem Post, December 15, 2025

Rare cooperation averts strike.

Isaiah 17:1 foretells Damascus's ruin. Lebanese army intervention pausing IDF action highlights fragile northern borders, setting scenes for prophetic regional upheavals.

20. IDF postpones planned strike on alleged Hezbollah site as Lebanese army searches it

Source: The Times of Israel, December 15, 2025

Coordination via ceasefire mechanism.

Psalm 83:3 warns of crafty counsel. Postponed strike amid Lebanese compliance reveals tense balances, prophetic of temporary calms before greater end-times confrontations with northern foes.
